sub_title: Project Coordinator for Talent Acquisition EMEA @ Spencer Stuart
summary:
Dedicated and intellectually curious Talent Acquisition professional with 2 years experience in supporting full-cycle external consultant recruitment across EMEA, with a particular focus on Financial Services and Private Equity. 

Experienced in project management and problem-solving, I take an interest in developing myself and my team members on a daily basis. Furthermore, I am continually committed to developing my impact and effectiveness in addition to my skills and knowledge. Drawn to the Private Equity, Financial Services, and Leadership Advisory sectors, I also take an interest in topics such as talent management/retention trends, employer branding, relationship building, and the importance of the human capital agenda in a firm’s success.

A cum laude graduate of BA International Studies at Universiteit Leiden, I was born in Chile and raised across Europe. From these experiences, I am multilingual, culturally sensitive, and internationally minded. I leverage my passion for DE&I advancements in the workplace on a daily basis, having recently been appointed DE&I Ambassador for Spencer Stuart’s Amsterdam Corporate office.

-----

Skills: Experienced Hires, Talent Mapping, Boolean Search, Market Research, Pipeline Building, Short List Candidate Recommendation, Source Identification.

Sector Coverage: Financial Services, FinTech, Private Equity, Leadership Advisory Services.

Geographic Experience: EMEA (particularly: UK, Nordics, BeNeLux, DACH)

Right to work: United Kingdom, Netherlands, Norway, Chile

certifications.name: NCFE Level 2 Certificate in Principles of Team Leading

profile_positions.description:
Spencer Stuart has 65 years’ experience in leadership consulting. Over the decades, as stakeholder expectations of leadership have evolved, we've built a reputation for delivering meaningful impact for our clients — from the world’s largest companies to entrepreneurial startups to nonprofit organizations. Through our portfolio of services and deep industry, functional and geographic expertise, we help build and enhance high-performing boards and executive teams who make a real difference in their organizations and beyond.

As a member of the Talent Acquisition team, Elise's responsibilities include:
• Supporting external Executive Search and Leadership Advisory Services Consultant recruitment in EMEA
• Research, talent-mapping of relevant candidate pools, sourcing, database updating, general support of the full-cycle recruiting process
• Working closely with senior stakeholders to guarantee a thorough sweep of the market is made for each search, ensuring high-quality and relevant prospects are put forth for consideration, offering initial advice along the way
• Proactive project management and participation in DE&I initiatives
• Administrative and communications support
• Recent work has covered the Financial Services and Private Equity (mainly Pre-Deal) industries, alongside Consumer, FinTech, Leadership Advisory, and TMT.
• Appointed DE&I Ambassador for Spencer Stuart's Amsterdam Corporate office
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator - Talent Acquisition EMEA

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a mentor, I take on students and alumni of Universiteit Leiden as mentees, advising them on understanding the consulting industry, using LinkedIn as a helpful tool, and navigating their options post-graduation.

Mentor profile: https://www.mentornetwerk.universiteitleiden.nl/app/community/mentor/3418857.

volunteer_experiences.role: Group Lead and Academic Consultant for Free Press Unlimited
volunteer_experiences.description:
Student Consultant for the NGO Free Press Unlimited as part of the BA International Studies third-year curriculum and course Practicing International Studies. Leading a team of students in working on a real-life consultancy project on methods of supporting journalism in exile. 

Tasks include researching, data gathering and writing to provide the partner organisation with valuable practical recommendations based on solid scientific research. 

Practising International Studies is an academic collaborative project course where teams of students reflect and analyse societal issues presented by organisational partners that operate in international environments. These leaders appeal to student teams to use their area-specific and multidisciplinary background in International Studies as well as their research capabilities to provide them with novel and critical insights to assist their future decision-making.

This course teaches students to merge their International Studies background in practice. Students learn to, conduct holistic research using their multidisciplinary grounding, that is, historical, cultural, economic and political—as taught from a Humanities perspective, and area expertise, to finally balance globalisation and contextualization to further progress on contemporary societal challenges.

https://studiegids.universiteitleiden.nl/en/courses/99950/practising-international-studies
https://www.freepressunlimited.org/en

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer and Social Media Manager | Voluntaria y Administradora de Redes Sociales
volunteer_experiences.description:
As the social media manager for our school’s chapter of the Norwegian Cancer Society, my responsibilities included gaining as much local exposure through social media, the press and the school’s society. We were able to fundraise approximately 80,000 NOK.

---

Como administradora de redes sociales de la sección de la Sociedad Noruega contra el Cáncer de nuestra escuela, mis responsabilidades incluían obtener la mayor exposición local a través de las redes sociales, la prensa y la sociedad escolar. Pudimos recaudar fondos aproximadamente 80,000 NOK.

volunteer_experiences.role: Team Leader and Delegate | Líder de Equipo y Delegada
volunteer_experiences.description:
As a delegate, I was an active participant in weekly meetings, and attended the SANMUN conferences in 2016 and 2017, and THIMUN 2018, where I successfully co-submitted and passed a resolution on measures to combat human trafficking in the Social and Humanitarian Committee.

As co-leader of my schools MUN chapter from 2017 to 2019, my responsibilities included organising weekly meetings, recruiting students, and gathering interest for national and international conferences.  

Furthermore, I co-founded an in-school conference in 2016, aimed at providing experience to pre-IB students on MUN and recruiting students to our chapter. Over the course of a year, my team and I organized the logistics of the conference, with our first conference in September 2017. I served as chair for the Social and Humanitarian Committee in this conference in both 2017 and 2018. In our 2018 conference, I was the co-leader in organising the entire conference and delegating tasks.

---

Como delegada, participé activamente en reuniones semanales, y asistí a las conferencias SANMUN en 2016 y 2017, y THIMUN 2018, donde co-presenté y aprobé con éxito una resolución sobre medidas para combatir la trata de personas en el Comité Social y Humanitario.

Como co-líder del capítulo de MUN de mi escuela de 2017 a 2019, mis responsabilidades incluyeron organizar reuniones semanales, reclutar estudiantes y generar interés para conferencias nacionales e internacionales.

Además, cofundé una conferencia en la escuela en 2016, con el objetivo de brindar experiencia a los estudiantes pre-IB en MUN y reclutar estudiantes. En el transcurso de un año, mi equipo y yo organizamos la logística de la conferencia, con nuestra primera conferencia en septiembre de 2017. Me desempeñé como presidente del Comité Social y Humanitario en esta conferencia tanto en 2017 como en 2018. En nuestra conferencia de 2018, fuí colíder en la organización de toda la conferencia y en la delegación de tareas.

volunteer_experiences.role: Fundraising Volunteer | Voluntaria de Recaudación de Fondos
volunteer_experiences.description:
During the Syrian refugee crisis, a teacher at my school created an Amnesty International club, in which I was an active member. My responsibilities included recruitment of students and initiating a clothing drive for local refugees. I was able to successfully gather enough clothes for a group of 30 refugees, including children's and maternity clothing.

Durante la crisis de los refugiados sirios, un profesor de mi escuela creó un club de Amnistía Internacional, del que yo era miembro activa. Mis responsabilidades incluían el reclutamiento de estudiantes e iniciar una campaña de recolección de ropa para los refugiados locales. Pude reunir con éxito ropa suficiente para un grupo de 30 refugiados, incluida ropa para niños y de maternidad.
